headline: Cake Mix Gingerbread Men
description: These adorable little gingerbread guys are quick and easy to make with spice cake mix. Let the kids use their imagination to decorate them!
name: Cake Mix Gingerbread Men
recipeIngredient: 1 package Duncan Hines® Moist Deluxe® Spice Cake Mix
1 tub Duncan Hines® Creamy Home-Style Vanilla Icing

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Combine cake mix, flour, eggs, oil, molasses, and ginger in a large bowl (mixture will be soft). Refrigerate 2 hours.

Place dough on a lightly floured surface; cover with waxed paper. Roll out dough to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut with a gingerbread man cookie cutter. Place 3 inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Decorate with nonpareil sprinkles.
Bake in the preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, or until edges start to brown. Remove immediately to a cooling rack.
Place icing in zip-top freezer bag. Snip the tip off one corner to make a small hole. Pipe a face and ruffles onto each cookie.

review.reviewBody: I have been making these for years now and they are so easy... my grandchildren think their Grandma is so smart because she makes these homemade Gingerbread Men... I'm glad that I am giving them something to remember
Delicious and beautiful! They do spread a bit while cooking, but it's easy to trim up pieces as soon as they come out of the oven, if needed. I'll definitely use this recipe again!

Delicious but there are a few errors in this recipe. recipe says “lightly floured surface” but you’ll need more flour than that. Do yourself a favor. Cover the area with parchment paper where you plan to knead, cover that with 3/4 cup flour (but keep an additional 1 3/4- 2 cups on hand in a bowl) and add to that from bowl as needed. Then knead dough directly with rolling pin. Wax paper between rolling pin and dough is not necessary. I found no “Duncan Hines Moist Deluxe Spice Cake” mix at neither Target nor Market Street. But at the latter, I did find Duncan Hines Signature Spice Cake mix. All errors considered, I’d still make this recipe again as it was very tasty. However, personally, I preferred the cookies that I didn’t roll out as thin as 1/4 in. because I like them more soft than crunchy.

I made no changes to the recipe. We made smaller assorted shaped cut outs which gave us a lot more cookies. This is the easiest recipe and most delicious that I have used in 40+ years. My grand daughter and family had a blast decorating them all. Thank you!!!!!

Wonderful easy recipe...
Instead of gingerbread man cookie cutter- I decided to be fun & make 'gingerbread pigs'... & instead of nonpareils... I used raisins for eyes...great fun with the family...

Sur La Table makes these gingerbread cookies that I absolutely adore, but they are $2 per cookie! Once my son realized he likes them too, I decided it was time to learn how to make them myself. This recipe is very easy and the cookies turned out delicious, as good as the Sur La Table cookies. We decorated them with royal icing. I followed the recipe exactly.

Sur La Table makes these gingerbread cookies that I absolutely adore, but they are $2 per cookie! Once my son realized he likes them too, I decided it was time to learn how to make them myself. This recipe is very easy and the cookies turned out delicious, as good as the Sur La Table cookies. We decorated them with royal icing. I followed the recipe exactly.

Only made a few changes, instead of vegetable oil I used butter & coconut oil. Also, used Sorghum Molasses instead of dark molasses. Sorghum has a more mild flavor. We really liked this recipe since we were looking for a gingerbread cookie that wasn’t as bold flavored as some recipes.

I got 37 3.5” cookies. If rolling on granite use parchment between the dough & countertop, lightly floured. Keep dough refrigerated between rolling small batches. Enjoy my amateur decorating .. first time using royal icing!

I did not make any changes to recipe. Yes, I would make them again. This is an easy recipe with minimal ingredients. 

I made them (purposely undecorated) to take to a Holiday children's party where they could decorate them themselves.
